chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tashawn M Vinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
lf probation will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. lf the defendant's probation is revoked with outstanding financial obligations and a jail sentence is ordered at the sentencing after revocation, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Court grants expunction upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant shall have no contact with LH.
Defendant shall have no contact with Washington County Fleet Farm Stores.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tashawn M. Vinson in court and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Pleas previously entered.  State is in compliance with victim rights.  Argument by counsel.  State takes no position on expungement.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court grants expungement.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tashawn M. Vinson in court in custody and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Resolution reached.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 2.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 2 and orders Cts. 1 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Case passed to allow State to check on compliance with victim rights.  Case recalled.  State requests an adjournment to check compliance.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tashawn M. Vinson in court in custody and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in court and by Atty. Edgar Beltran.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Photocopy of complaint and bond emailed to CIB upon request
No contact with LH, EJ, RSK, or DS; No contact with any Washington County Fleet Farms; Absolute sobriety; Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tashawn M Vinson in court, in custody.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Tashawn M Vinson. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. SPD to appoint.  Court sets $2500 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
